meanings.definition: The upper interior surface of a room.
meanings.sent1: The ceiling in the classroom was painted blue.
meanings.sent2: Please don't throw anything at the ceiling.
meanings.sent3: The ceiling seemed to be listening to the teacher's lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high, touching the ceiling of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The spider crawled along the ceiling, unnoticed by the students.

meanings.definition: An upper limit set on something, such as prices or levels.
meanings.sent1: The company has set a ceiling on the prices of their products.
meanings.sent2: We need to break through the ceiling of our limitations.
meanings.sent3: The ceiling on the number of attendees was quickly reached.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was hitting her head on a glass ceiling in her career.
meanings.sent5: The ceiling on the elevator prevented it from going any higher.
